events.name: Hands on with Version Control System "GIT"
events.description:
VCS (Version Control System) is the necessity in product/application/project development. Most of the Companies who have a strict systematic structure have implemented VCS.

VCS helps to maintain the code base and also helps the developers to manage their code versions that they have developed. A lot more can be done with VCS.

In this event, participants will learn What is the importance of VCS and how to integrate one of the most used VCS - GIT.

Participants will learn how create a repository? how to manage own and other remote repository and many stuff related to GIT.

Prerequisites:

• Laptop with GIT installed.

• Basic knowledge of Programming and Command Prompt.

• To install the GIT follow this link

events.name: Hands on with Version Control System "GIT" - Part 2
events.description:
We are ready with the second part of our event series "Hands on With Version Control System - GIT".

In previous event, we have learnt:

• what is VCS, different available VCS

• basics of GIT, how it works

• How to create own repository

• How to commit and track all the commits 

• And at last, we ended up with creating a remote repository on GitHub. 

Note: Those who missed these all can refer this link for the presentation.

In this second part, we will learn:

•  How to manage remote repository

•  How to track all the changes simultaneously

•  How to create multiple branches

•  How to send pull request and some more details of GIT and GitHub.

Prerequisites:

• Laptop with GIT installed. 

• GitHub account with 2 repositories titled as <yourname>_GDGHOW_GIT_1 & <yourname>_GDGHOW_GIT_2

Speaker: Dhrumil Shah

events.name: Explore Marshmallow: Android App Permission
events.description:
Android 6.0 "Marshmallow" is the latest version of the Android mobile operating system. It comes up with some noticeable features like new permission architecture, a new power management system, native support for fingerprint etc.

In this event, participants will learn What is the architecture of new permission model. How to ask for runtime permission to the user.

Currently, Android apps require you to grant access to phone or features before you install, like storage, images, contacts, location etc.  With Android Marshmallow’s, new App Permissions functionality is totally changed and apps need to ask for permission when it needs in the app.

Participants will learn how to manage runtime permissions? How to deal with the flow of permissions.

Prerequisites:

• Laptop with Android Studio & SDK with latest API version. I.e. 23 & Android Support Library version 23

• Basic knowledge of Android Programming

events.name: Unit Testing Android Code and MVP Pattern
events.description:
Unit tests are the fundamental tests in your app testing strategy. By creating and running unit tests against your code, you can easily verify that the logic of individual units is correct. Running unit tests after every build helps you to quickly catch and fix software regressions introduced by code changes to your app.

Android tests are based on JUnit, and you can run them either as local unit tests on the JVM or as instrumented tests on an Android device. This page provides an introduction to the concepts and tools for building Android tests.

In this session introduces the clean structure of well written unit tests and you will learn

- What is Local Unit Testing?

- How Local Unit test helps my app less buggy?

- MVP Pattern for Unit Test

Speaker

• Chintan Rathod

events.name: Let's explore RxJava - RxAndroid
events.description:
What is RxJava? 

RxJava is very powerful tool which helps Android code to understand and maintain very easily. Using RxJava, application can be created with lesser bug. With RxJava many complex tasks can be accomplished easily and without errors. As RxJava is new for Android developer, they might have questions like Why? How? When? In this talk, audience will have very useful RxJava information with example of implementing in Applications.

Speakers

Paresh Mayani

Paresh Dudhat

events.name: Women Techmakers : Ahmedabad

To date, Women Techmakers has been a series of Google Developers Live shows, as well as talks and networking events during Google I/O. In 2014, Women Techmakers is expanding into a global program that will increase the visibility, community, and resources for technical women in industry. 

That’s why, in conjunction with International Women's Day on March 8th, Google Developers Group Ahmedabad is organizing a Women Techmaker event which would geared towards increasing visibility, community and resources for technical women in our Ahmedabad.

events.name: Building Bots with Python (Beginner)
events.description:
What is a ChatBot?

A ChatBot is a software service with which users communicate via chat interface. The scope of this service varies from basic functionalities to entertainment area, to business interactions and much more. This service can be embedded into any chat application like Facebook Messenger, Telegram, Text Messages, etc. The most familiar example would be Google Assistant.

Why is this important to you?

ChatBots are important for anyone and everyone from technical domain, startup segment and from marketing point of view like

1. Startup/Business - People today are more engaged in messaging apps than social networking apps.

2. Marketing - If you want to target more customers for your business, then you definitely need ChatBot to reach larger audience.

Session Overview

You will learn Flask Framework in Python and then shift gears towards learning how to create ChatBots using Python. You will get more knowledge about NLP, AI and ML.

Prerequisite

Basic Programming Knowledge.

Speakers

Kashyap Raval : He is a Python developer, passionate about machine learning/Deep learning  and NLP.

Rajat Talesra : He is a passionate Android Developer with teaching Android more than 2 years. He is also a Google Facilitator for Applied CS with Android Course and Founder of WiseL.

Daxeel Soni : He is a Python developer, passionate about ChatBot and building things with python. Founder at GetPrattle.

events.name: Jenkins : Automating the Continuous Integration of Android App
events.description:
[UPDATE]:

1)  We have increased the seats. If you are in waitlist kindly contact us if you really want to attend this session.

2) Those who have RSVPed and will not be able to attend this session, kindly change your RSVP from Yes to No.

3) Before coming for an event. Kindly go through the Event description carefully. 


IMPORTANT: This event is not for Students, but for only experienced professionals.

Talk Abstract: 

Jenkins is open source tool to perform continuous integration and build automation. Jenkins is a  piece of software and has a large number of available plugins to make developer life easier. It is is a Java-first Continuous Integration platform and already has fantastic support for Gradle. 
So this topic covers,

1. Configuring Jenkins

2. Configuring Android Project  

3. Configuring Android Project with Git

Pre-requisite:

Android SDK installed
Git installed
JDK installed

events.name: Mitigating Data Theft Attack in Android

venue.name: Lets Nurture
venue.address_1: C- 404 Ganesh Meridian, Nr. High Court, S.G. Highway, Ahmedabad

events.description:
About Topic: Security to the Android application is difficult task because android is one of the most widely used mobile platforms. It runs on a wide range of devices, from mobile smartphones and tablets, to set-top boxes. So we wanted to specifically focus on one element of Android security. Potentially Harmful Applications (PHA). It includes Backdoors, Billing fraud, Spyware, Hostile Downloads, Trojan Apps.

You will be learning below things,

Steps need to follow while writing code:-

1) Proguard

2)Android Lint

3)Android compatibility test suite

Steps need to follow while storing the data:-

1)shared preference

2)Internal storage

3)External storage

4)Content provider

5)SQLite

Android security features:-

1)Verify apps

2)Safety nets:

Tampering Detection in android with codelab

Tampering detection is a preventive measure used in mobile applications to help

Ensuring that a third party hasn’t recompiled and published your application

Under their account or store without your consent

There are 2 different approaches:-

1)Check if application has been renamed.

2)Check if application has been published without your consent.

Speaker: Rashmi Sridar
(3 years experienced Developer)

Rashmi is working as a Software Developer at Visual Infosoft Pvt Ltd, Ahmedabad. She loves to develop mobile application and learn new technologies. She is passionate about research and stay updated with latest trends. At last she wants to contribute to embolden women in tech world.

events.name: Hands-on: Dagger 2
events.description:
IMPORTANT: This event is not for Students, but for only experienced professionals.

PREREQUISITES: It is mandatory to carry laptop.

TALK ABSTRACT:
Dagger2 is been here since 2015 though average developers are not able to get the underlying architecture and its usage. This talk covers deep understanding about annotation processors, how Dagger2 works under the hood, how to rebuild current application architecture with Dagger2 and detailing about Dagger2 annotations.

SPEAKER:
Chintan Soni - He is a passionate Sr. Android Developer at Simform Solutions Pvt. Ltd., has been exploring and strengthening his roots in Android Development since more than 4 years. Not only in Android, but also he has experience on various cross platform tools, Back-end and Web technologies. In his free time, he contributes to developer community at Github and Stackoverflow. A good Sniper in CounterStrike ;)

events.name: Animation 101
events.description:
TALK ABSTRACT:
Animations can add subtle visual cues that notify users about what’s going on in your app and improve their mental model of your app’s interface. Google has blessed us with awesome support for Animation in Android and two amazing speakers for that matter, Romain Guy and Chet Haase, ironically both are on Android Graphics Team.
We’ll understand today how we can get started with using animations in our own apps.

SPEAKER:
Hardip Patel:
He is the Founder, Developer and quite sometimes Maidservant at Anormaly Labs. He loves exploring Android and did some dabbling with NodeJS, AngularJS (Not very Proud), Laravel, etc. Besides that he has involvement with many programming languages on "Hello World!" basis. In his plenteous time, he usually sketches, eats and learns discrete unfitting talents like Solving Rubik's Cube, Daydreaming and Touching his nose with his tongue. You can hit it off with him if you're interested in Programming, Design Thinking, Anime/Manga and Drawing/Art.

Dhruva Shastri:
Her interests as an inquisitive person, is to learn new things everyday. As a developer, currently experienced with Android application development. Also, currently learning & exploring designing due to keen interest. Looking to get opportunities in the same field, UI/UX to be specific.

events.name: Android Things: Things matter

venue.name: Simform Solutions Pvt. Ltd.
venue.address_1: 312-B Dev Arc Complex, Above Woodland Showroom, Near Iscon Cross Road

events.description:
Task abstract

Android Things is an Android-based embedded operating system platform by Google. Android Things lets you build professional, mass-market products on a trusted platform, without previous knowledge of embedded system design. This talk covers 1) How to start with Andorid Things, Flash OS on developement board and Connect devices with Raspberry pi using MQTT protocol by Mayur Solanki, 2) Control devices using Android mobile & Google Assistant application by Jaldeep Asodariya.

You will be learning below things,
- Getting started with Android Things
- How to build and flash OS on development board
- Control devices using MQTT protocol (Raspberry Pi 3 Model B, Breadboard, LED)
- Control devices through Google Assistant (NXP Pico i.MX7D, Breadboard, LED, Google Home, Dialogflow application, Firebase Real time database & Cloud Functions)

Speakers

Mayur Solanki
Mayur is Android developer in one of the product base company of Ahmedabad with 3 years of experience. He is passionate to develop Android apps and to learn new technologies in Android. He always keeps him self updated with latest trends and tweak of Android world. He loves to play Don't tap the white tiles (Piano tile) mobile game.

Jaldeep Asodariya
Jaldeep is an Android Developer and working at Jain Bhavesh Solutions. As he developed many enormous emerging Android Application so far and got client’s satisfaction through his Development work. He is a core organising team member of Google Developer Group (GDG), Ahmedabad.

He is very much interested in IoT (Internet of Things) and Android Things. He has good hands over to develop Google Assistant Applications as well as he has proficient knowledge in NodeJS.

events.description:
First Dedicated Event to learn about Flutter.

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

You will learn how to start with Flutter. Flutter uses Dart as a language. In this meetup, you will also learn the basics of Dart which is required to start with Flutter.

• What to bring

https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

About: Parth is a guy who is trying to grow up and do mature stuff and work but ends up designing, playing games(most of the time) or watching Movies/Tv Series.Parth has five years of experience in designing and two years experience in front-end development. Parth uses Angular for Creating frontend, ionic and Flutter to create hybrid apps. Parth has mastery over most of the adobe creative suite apps.
Currently, Parth is exploring Flutter as he believes it can be a replacement for ionic 2 and all other hybrid app frameworks.

2) Name: Dhrumil Shah, Mobile Developer @Shipmnts & Co-organiser @GDGAhmedabad

Being a techno freak, his interest lies in developing apps, sharing knowledge by delivering talk, workshop and doing research.

events.name: A Joy Ride with Jetpack
events.description:
[WTM Event]

Google IO 2018 brought some awesome improvements that eased developers life by building new Architectures, Frameworks and Libraries. Jetpack is a pack of libraries, tools and architectural guidance that simply helps erase the nightmares of every Android developers out there. With this talk, introduce some of the important components of Jetpack. Participants will get initial thrust to start using Jetpack components.

Talk Title: A Joy Ride with Jetpack

Speakers:
1) Hardi Patel
She is an energetic and young developer who is able to work alongside other talented IT professionals in creating mobile apps of very highest standards. She has high awareness of industry issues and trends, particularly in regards to emerging technologies. Currently working with Volansys Technologies. Apart from Android , just started exploring flutter.

2) Chintan Soni
He is a passionate Sr. Software Engineer at Simform Solutions Pvt. Ltd., has been exploring and strengthening his roots in Android Development for more than 5 years. Not only in Android, but also he has experience on various cross platform frameworks and tools, Back-end and Web technologies. In his free time, he contributes to developer community at Github and Stackoverflow. A good Sniper in CounterStrike ;)

Prerequisites:

events.name: Flutter Study Jams [Part 1] - GDG Ahmedabad

events.description:

Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join GDG Ahmedabad and WTM Ahmedabad for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll learn from Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Bring a laptop!

For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time.
Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Speakers:
1) Dhrumil Shah
Co-organiser of GDG Ahmedabad & Mobile Developer at Shipmnts

2) Bhavik Makwana:

An Open source enthusiast, Google Certified Associate Android Developer and Google Scholar for the Android Nanodegree.
He is a fanboy of Flutter and ConstraintLayout

events.name: Open source Awesomeness of Elastic Stack

venue.name: Ecosmob Technologies Pvt. Ltd.
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor, D Block, Satyam Corporate Square, Sindhu Bhavan Marg, Bodakdev

events.description:
Data is not the new oil. Many sectors thrived on building scalable and performant systems. Now, we are at a interesting juncture to be able to collect, collate and comprehend data from different sources.

Talk Title: Open source Awesomeness of Elastic Stack
Talk Abstract:
Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana and Beats) is such a open source platform which is built for scalability, performance and it is mainly used for “You know.. for Search”. When you have a such system which scales to the horizons of you data, helps you in your data quest, shows you insights - imagine what you can do with it.

Join Aravind Putrevu, as he explains popular open source developer platform and How it can add value to learnings?.
Aravind will also explain various practical use cases of Elastic Stack while demonstrating some.

Speaker: Aravind Putrevu
Aravind is passionate about evangelising technology, meeting developers and helping in solving their problems. He is a backend developer and has six years of development experience.

Currently he works at Elastic as Developer Advocate and looks after the Developer Relation function of India. Previously, He worked at McAfee Antivirus as a Engineer in Cloud Security Domain. He has deep interest in Search, Machine Learning, Security Incident Analysis and IoT tech. In his free time, he plays around Raspi or a Arduino.

events.name: MLCC Study Jam [Part 1]

venue.name: DEV Accelerator LLP
venue.address_1: C-201, 2nd Floor, The First, B/h Keshav Baugh Party Plot Nr. Shivalik High-Street, Vastrapur

events.description:
[NOTE] Please make a note that this will be events of two dedicated Saturdays where you have to be present in both the event of the Study Jam. If you feel you will not be able to make it for the event kindly DO NOT RSVPED yourself.

Including RSVP, Registration is also mandatory. Registered participants will be welcomed only. So Kindly Register yourself to attend this event.
Registration Link: http://bit.ly/2PM6aCa

It's no more a secret that Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming the way we live and work, like never before, revolutionizing the world around us. India, home to over a million developers are openly embracing the power of AI across different sectors. Contributing to this larger idea of building an “AI empowered India”, Google has launched Machine Learning (ML) Study Jam Series to enable a platform to learn for ML enthusiasts.

In the pre-session of ML Study Jam at GDGAhmedabad, you will get the basics of Machine Learning, Regression, Classification, it's real-life applications and frameworks to be used. Apart from it, you will explore the hands-on session of Deep Learning which is the current trending sub-field of ML.

Prerequisites:

Do join with your fully charged laptops with battery backup, Internet and a can-do attitude!

We highly recommend you to go through and complete following materials to understand Machine Learning concepts well.

* Mastery of intro-level algebra:
- comfortable with variables and coefficients
- linear equations
- graphs of functions
- histograms
(Familiarity with more advanced math concepts such as logarithms and derivatives is helpful, but not required.)

* Proficiency in programming basics, and some experience coding in Python:
You should feel comfortable reading and writing Python code (https://www.python.org/) that contains basic programming constructs, such as function definitions/invocations, lists and dicts, loops, and conditional expressions.

Here is link to help you prepare above topics: http://bit.ly/2D60X6J
(Following Key Concepts and Tools from Math to Basic Python Programing)

Speakers:
1) Kashyap Raval
Kashyap is Python Team Leader at Let'sNurture working with AI and IoT. He is passionate about Machine Learning/ Deep Learning and NLP also. Apart from his day job, He serves as a Co-Organizer at pydata Ahmedabad and Codemeet groups. He has been working with AI and Chatbots since long time. He has also been selected as Student Ambassador of nurture.ai

2) Charmi Chokshi
Working with data and predicting future based on it is Charmi's passion and it has always made her feel like a Magician! She is an AI and Data enthusiast who is always willing to learn from new challenges and love to share the experiences with others. She has facilitated the first pilot of Machine Learning Crash Course in India back in September 2017. She has worked as Research Trainee at Indian Space Research Organisation in summer 2018 and currently, pursuing her final year of ICT Engineering from Ahmedabad University.

events.name: MLCC Study Jam [Part 2]

venue.name: DEV Accelerator LLP
venue.address_1: C-201, 2nd Floor, The First, B/h Keshav Baugh Party Plot Nr. Shivalik High-Street, Vastrapur

events.description:
[Important] Including RSVP, Registration is also mandatory. Registered participants will be welcomed only. So Kindly Register yourself to attend this event.
Registration Link: http://bit.ly/2PM6aCa

Participants who did registration in Part-1 won't be required again to do. Just mark RSVP to yes. But we'll be rechecking the entries from previous sheet before giving an entry as we did in Part - 1.

[Most Important] If you have missed to attend MLCC Pre-session Part -1, we highly suggest you to complete the prerequisites and self learning exercise shared by a speaker in comment at below link first before registering for this event.
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Ahmedabad/events/254769454/

Schedule:
09:30 am to 01:00 pm - session with hands-on
01:00 pm to 01:30 pm - lunch (we'll be providing to the registered ones)
01:30 pm to 04:00 pm - session with hands-on
04:00 to 04:30 pm - open discussion and networking

This time we'll be doing hands-on along with topics discussion by speakers.
Do join with your fully charged laptops with battery backup, Internet and a can-do attitude!

Machine Learning Crash Course is a course specially designed by Google to help take people from minimal or no ML knowledge to a point where they can train simple linear or neural network models in TensorFlow. We aim to give them enough knowledge to understand various pitfalls, classic errors, and tradeoffs.

MLCC is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical, applied perspective that will enable them to use machine learning within their everyday projects, and who wish to benefit from the power of TensorFlow wrapped in convenient higher-level abstractions.
This is a great opportunity for audience with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

Speakers:
1) Krupa Galiya
A PyGirl whose main interest lies in AI, NLP, and Algorithms.
Currently, she is exploring advanced AI concepts and tends to do algorithms from scratch. She has completed various projects based on Machine Learning/Deep Learning, NLP and Python. She loves to share knowledge and do research.
Currently, pursuing BE-IT from Vishwakarma Govt. engineering college in the third year.

2) Charmi Chokshi
Working with data and predicting future based on it is Charmi's passion and it has always made her feel like a Magician! She is an AI and Data enthusiast who is always willing to learn from new challenges and love to share the experiences with others. She has facilitated the first pilot of Machine Learning Crash Course in India back in September 2017. She has worked as Research Trainee at Indian Space Research Organisation in summer 2018 and currently, pursuing her final year of ICT Engineering from Ahmedabad University.

3) Krunal Kapadiya
Krunal is working at Volansys. He is one of the first 50 Google certified Associate Android Developer from India. He started to learn Machine Learning since long time. He also completed Machine Learning Foundation nanpdegree. In leisure time he likes to read books.

events.name: Frontiers of Artificial Intelligence
events.description:
Speaker: Harsh Mehta, Research Software Engineer @ Google

Bio:
He is a part of Google's AI research and engineering team, working specifically on problems related to Natural Language Processing. He also regularly teaches MLCC and other machine learning courses at Google. He likes to work on challenging problems with super-smart folks and have fun doing it.

Topic: "Frontiers of AI"
We'll discuss how much progress the AI community has made in the past, talk about a few key trends which are relevant right now and then finally switch to what does the future look like (mostly 3-5 years out, its hard to predict more than that).

Prerequisites:
No coding ability required. Just an open mind and some familiarity with Deep Learning.

events.name: Flutter Meetup: Let's Understand Flare and Codemagic.io
events.description:
In Flutter Live there are much new stuff gets announced. If you are not aware of or want to learn more this meetup is for you.

In this meetup, two new tools will be discussed. 1) Flare to create butter smooth animation and 2) Codemagic which is the first CI/CD platform specifically for Flutter.

Speaker Details:
1) Martin Jeret
Martin leads business development for Codemagic. He works closely with businesses and the Flutter community. Previously he has founded an app based startup, started his own consultancy and even worked on the national AI strategy for Estonia. He likes to listen to B.B. King and play blues guitar.

2) Dhrumil Shah
Mobile Developer at Shipmnts.com and co-organiser of GDG Ahmedabad.

events.name: Machine Learning for Imbalanced Class Distributions
events.description:
We could easily overfit machine learning with the data we have, but the quest to reduce the generalization errors, have pushed the Machine Learning researchers to implement new algorithms, and one of the criterion in Supervised Machine Learning, the balance of data distributions is important, but most of the real life datasets are imbalanced, and this gives the zeal to study new algorithms to drive business and research forward. There are various methods at data level and at algorithm level that solves this problem, we will discuss both of them and try to implement both the methods, in this hands-on session.

Prerequisites:

Knowledge of basic supervised machine learning algorithms, Python programming language and basic understanding of data-set would make easier for you to understand the delivering content.

As we are going to perform hands-on, the ones going to run Online, we'll be using Colab. Costcla pre-installed will be good to have for that.

For Offliners, we will be using Jupyter notebook for visualization, pre-installed tflearn, sklearn, imblearn, pandas, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn, costcla, xgboost, geoip (optional) will be helpful.

we will use python3 and pycharm in general.

Additionally, interested ones to perform the hands-on, do join with your fully charged laptops with battery backup, Internet on your own and a can-do attitude!

Speaker:
Tanisha Bhayani:
She is an Associate AI Researcher at F(x) Data Labs Pvt. Ltd. With a strong interest in Research in AI, she tries to implement the research papers she reads, and also implement the new ideas she gets!

events.name: Blockchain: Let's make it Simple
events.description:
9:30 to 10:00 AM

A short surprise talk from a Googler.

10:00 AM onward

Speaker: Akash Gianchandani

He is having 3+ years of development experience in variety of technologies like MATLAB, Simulink, MEAN stack etc. He is passionate about learning futuristic technologies, hence he has started exploring Blockchain. He is a Blockchain Team Lead at SoluLab Inc. His main area of focus was public Blockchain like Ethereum and now exploring private Blockchain like Hyperledger.

Talk Abstract

We will look into the basics of Blockchain, will try to understand how this technology works and what makes it one of the fanciest terms in the tech industry right now. We will look into the basic concepts of Ethereum Blockchain, Dapps and then finally look at what lies in the future for blockchain.

Mehul has more than 10 years of industry experience in managing automation & performance activities in multiple companies, starting from building-up the automation frameworks, planning & implementing automation/performance best practices and writing/executing automation scripts for faster & quality-oriented product releases.

events.name: Learn CNN and Transfer Learning
events.description:
We bring one more event for ML enthusiasts.

In the first session we are going to explore Convolutional Neural Network.

A convolutional neural network (CNN) is a specific type of artificial neural network that uses perceptrons, a machine learning unit algorithm, for supervised learning, to analyze data. Convolutional Neural Network is one of the main categories to do images recognition, images classifications. Objects detections, recognition faces etc.

You will learn about

- Computer Vision
- CNN & Types
- Edge Detection
- Construction and Working of CNN
- CNN Architectures
- Data Augmentations
- Transfer Learning
- Object Detections
- YOLO

Speaker : Manthan Ladva

He is exploring M.L. concepts and Now exploring Computer Vision and related frameworks.
He explored CNN and now moving forward for Flutter + TensorFlow + Computer Vision.

Second session we will go deep inside Transfer Learning and will cover following topics.

Transfer learning make use of the knowledge gained while solving one problem and applying it to a different but related problem.

- Transfer Learning Scenarios
- Importance of Transfer Learning
- Transfer Learning Strategies
- Single Task Transfer Learning
- Inductive Transfer Leanring
- Transfer Learning with CNN

Speaker : Hiren Dave

Prerequisites:

Knowledge of basic machine learning algorithms, Python programming language.

events.name: Build Your Own Angular Library and Schematics
events.description:
Angular Library

Reusability is core concept for software engineering. As a good developer you should always think about making reusable libraries and classes in your project. Libraries are supported in languages like PHP, Java or .Net. But what about frontend languages like JavaScript or TypeScript? Well, this is possible now with Angular. Since Angular 6, Angular CLI comes with ng-packager to generate and build Angular Libraries. This event is all about building Angular Libraries.

We will start with how to create Angular Library project using Angular CLI and at end the event you will have deployable Angular Library that can be reused in any of the project.

Before starting the event we would like to know your ideas about making Angular library and we would like you to build and publish Angular Libraries and share details with us.

Schematics

Angular schematics are great work flow tool for the modern web. Angular CLI uses schematics to apply transforms to web app projects. Schematics are easy to modify and define new ones to do things like update your code to fix breaking changes in a dependency or to add a new configuration option or framework to an existing project.

We will see how you can define your custom schematics or override existing schematics in your app.

These are hands on session, where you can bring your laptop with network connection and you can build library and schematics along with us.

Speakers :

Jinal Shah
Hiren Dave

Jinal Shah is the co-founder of Brainoorja Creations (www.brainoorja.com) and a corporate trainer imparting knowledge on various cutting-edge technologies, such as – Node JS, Angular and ionic. His IT skills and continuous contribution to developer community has earned him Microsoft MVP (Most Valuable professional) Award. Jinal is having a B.E degree in Computer Science, and is actively associated with academics and training programs for students enrolled in various IT courses in various technical institutions.

His hobbies are research, development and training in upcoming web & mobile technologies.

Social Media:

twitter:@jinalshah999
Medium:https://medium.com/@jinalshah999
LinkedIn:www.linkedin.com/in/jinalshah999

events.name: Animation with Rive in Flutter
events.description:
[WTM Event]

Animations make apps visually appealing.

In this session we will cover to get started with animations using Animation Class and Animation Controller in flutter.

After having the clear understanding of basic animations we'll move to take a ride of Rive.

Rive is a real-time interactive design tool that allows you to design, animate, and immediately integrate your assets into any platforms.

Speakers:

1) Thakker Khushbu
Sr.Android developer & Flutter Explorer

She is working as android developer since 3+ year and passionate about exploring new technologies and currently explorering flutter.

2) Dhruva Shastri

Her interests as an inquisitive #WomenInTech is to learn new every day, so I continually look out for areas that interest her to work on. Apart from that, Being a community lover, playing a role as an Ambassador at WTM Ahmedabad, enthusiast about emboldening women in every sphere of their life and I enjoy people’s synergy.

3) Ayush Bherwani

Ayush is an Undergraduate student who is passionate about developing mobile apps in Flutter. Apart from Mobile Development, his interest lies in developing Mobile DApps.

events.name: While Working From Home - Best Practices/Tips/Tricks
events.description:
[Update]
Youtube link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nFesWvVSuAI

Many of us and our companies are starting working from home or have already started during the past weeks.

During this time, many of us are working remotely and experiencing the same for the very first time and there we have thought about hosting a virtual event over Youtube Live Streaming, wherein we would be sharing best practices and the stuffs to take care while working remotely.

We may have this event in multiple seasons (if you are having experience working remotely and would like to share your experience with us, please let us know!). To start with, we will have at least following speakers during tomorrow's event:

1. Hiren Dave
2. Utpal Betai
3. Paresh Mayani & Dhrumil Shah

events.name: Web Performance - Decoding Page Speed Reports [Online Event]
events.description:
[Youtube live link] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8PSvE5UxQsQ

Performance plays a major role in the success of any web application.

Slow web applications have a negative impact on users and particularly if you run a business on the web, performance is crucial. If your web application experience is fast and responsive to user inputs, it can survive or else you will not be able to retain and grow your users.

There are many tools available in market. Few of the such tools are LightHouse from Google and GTMatrix. But how many us understand the reports generated by such tools.

This event is all about Decoding Page Speed Reports generated by these tools.

This event will cover

- How these reports are generated,
- What affects variations in them, and
- Deep dive into various user experience specific metrics that are used by Google's Lighthouse.

Speaker : Dhaval Shah

Dhaval is an independent Web Consultant with a focus on technical SEO, web performance, and API integrations.

When he’s not coding, he is active on Twitter, participating in various slack channels and loves to chill out with his two kids.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/dhavalgshah

events.name: My love-hate relationship with Android Studio
events.description:
[YouTube Live Link] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-gHwiHsZR0

Android Studio is the tool of the trade hands down. When it comes to Android (app/library/IoT) development, the first thing that comes to mind is to install Android Studio and get going from there. From the speaker's own experience, he will talk about his love-hate relationship with Android Studio.

This talk will focus on and cover
- What Android Studio gets right and what it doesn’t
- How to be embrace performance when Android Studio is the bottleneck in the workflow (slow build times and reduced productivity),
- How switching to a terminal and various tools that exist in the ecosystem can give Android developers the much-needed speed boost and in-depth view in their development workflow

By the end of this talk, you would have embraces a workflow that allows for increased productivity and faster development.

Speaker: Nishant Srivastava

Nishant is an Android Engineer based in Berlin, Germany. He is an open source enthusiast who spends his time doodling when not hacking on Android, while also being a caffeine-dependent life-form. He can be found either talking about android libraries or advocating that coffee is the elixir of life at community gatherings. He has experience in Android SDK Engineering, Firmware Engineering and Audio Digital Signal Processing(DSP) on Android.

He is an Intel Software Innovator and part of the raywenderlich.com’s Android & Flutter Team.

He has been part of 3 startups in the past, ranging from being the Founding team member at OmniLabs, Inc., being the First employee at Silverpush for whom he developed the company’s patented UAB (Unique Audio Beacon) Technology [Patent 1,Patent 2] [Featured in Techcrunch, Business Today, Live Mint] to being an Android Engineer at Soundbrenner where he dabbled in the art of Firmware Engineering a bit for their custom wearable product, Core while managing their Android application.

Website: https://nisrulz.com/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/nisrulz

upcoming.name: [Online] Levelling up as Developer
upcoming.description:
Youtube Stream URL:
We will set it up and share it soon.

Abstract:
If you think that learning new technologies/frameworks is enough to take your development career to the next level, you are likely missing out on creating a wider impact both from a personal and professional career level. Learn how you can take your development journey to the next level via a set of tips and experiences that will be shared during the session.

About Speaker:
Romin Irani works at Google, specifically on Google Cloud Platform. 25 years experienced young developer exploring the horizon of Software industry, passionate about helping developers succeed. More on his blog https://rominirani.com/ and You may follow him on https://twitter.com/iRomin

upcoming.name: Reactive Programming in Angular with RxJs
upcoming.description:
When we work an Angular Application, it's already reactive programming but using RxJs it can be much better and can be scalable.

RxJs is Reactive Extensions For JavaScript. RxJS allows you to solve hard problems with less code, promotes maintainability, readability, flexibility. These are few reasons on why RxJS is the better way to handle async operations right now. RxJS allows you to increase the power of your application with reactive programming techniques. In just a few lines of maintainable code, you can have multiplex web sockets and easily coordinate multiple Ajax requests. RxJS is also great for state management with asynchronous data flows. With RxJs, you can handle this in a declarative and flexible way alongside redux or you can replace Redux altogether.

This event is all about Reactive Programming in Angular with RxJs. We will learn following core concept of RxJs

Observables
Observers
Subscriptions

Also we will see how we can handle HTTP requests with RxJs and how we can manage states with RxJs in your Angular application.

This is hands on session for the experienced developers. You can bring your laptop along with network connections.

Speakers

Jinal Shah
Hiren Dave
